sen.j: 葵祭（あおいまつり、正式には賀茂祭）は、京都市の賀茂御祖神社（下鴨神社）と賀茂別雷神社（上賀茂神社）で、5月15日（陰暦四月の中の酉の日）に行なわれる例祭。
sen.e: Aoi Matsuri (formally, Kamo Matsuri) is an annual celebration taken place at Kamo Mioya Jinja Shrine (Shimogamo Jinja Shrine) and Kamo Wakeikazuchi Jinja shrine (Kamigamo Jinja Shrine) on May 15th (the middle day of Cock day of lunar calendar).

Aoi Matsuri (formally, Kamo Matsuri) is an annual celebration that takes place at Kamo Mioya Jinja Shrine (Shimogamo Jinja Shrine) and Kamo Wakeikazuchi Jinja shrine (Kamigamo Jinja Shrine) on May 15th (the middle day of Cock day of lunar calendar).

Aoi Matsuri (formally known as Kamo Matsuri) is an annual celebration that takes place at Kamomioya-jinja Shrine (Shimogamo-jinja Shrine) and Kamowakeikazuchi-jinja Shrine (Kamigamo-jinja Shrine) in Kyoto City on May 15 (the middle day of Cock day of lunar calendar).
sen.cmt: 京都市、を補足、マイページに合わせました。

sen.j: 石清水八幡宮の南祭に対し北祭ともいう。
sen.e: While a matsuri of Iwashimizu Hachimangu Shrine is called the South Festival, Aoi Matsuri is called the North Festival.
While the Iwashimizu Hachimangu Shrine matsuri is called the South Festival, Aoi Matsuri is called the North Festival.
While the Iwashimizu Hachimangu Shrine matsuri is called the South Festival, Aoi Matsuri is called the North Festival.

sen.j: 平安時代、「祭」といえば賀茂祭のことをさした。
sen.e: In the Heian period, Matsuri (Festival) simple means Kamo Matsuri.
During the Heian period, Matsuri (Festival) simply means Kamo Matsuri.
During the Heian period, Matsuri (Festival) simply means Kamo Matsuri.

sen.j: 石清水八幡宮、春日大社と共に三勅祭の一つであり、庶民の祭りである祇園祭に対して、賀茂氏と朝廷の行事として行っていたのを貴族たちが見物に訪れる、貴族の祭となった。
sen.e: While Gion Matsuri is a festival of general public, Kamo Matsuri is one of the Three Festivals of Ordinance together with the festivals of Iwashimizu Hachimangu Shrine and Kasuga Taisha Shrine, and Kamo Matsuri was an event of Kamo clan and Imperial court which court nobles visited and enjoy, and then became a festival of the court nobles.

While the Gion Matsuri is a festival for the general public, the Kamo Matsuri is one of the Three Festivals of Ordinance together with the festivals of Iwashimizu Hachimangu Shrine and Kasuga Taisha Shrine, and Kamo Matsuri was an event of the Kamo clan and Imperial court which court nobles visited and enjoyed, and it then became a festival for the court nobles.

While the Gion Festival is a festival for the general public, it is one of sanchokusai (three great festivals designated by Japan's imperial court), together with the festivals of Iwashimizu Hachimangu Shrine and Kasuga Taisha Shrine, and it became an event of the Kamo clan and the Imperial court which court nobles visited and enjoyed, and it then became a festival for the court nobles.

sen.j: 京都市の観光資源としては、京都三大祭りの一つ。
sen.e: Kamo Matsuri is one of the three largest festivals in Kyoto as the resources of tourism in Kyoto City.
The Kamo Matsuri is one of the three largest festivals in Kyoto considered a resource for tourism in Kyoto City.
It is one of the three largest festivals in Kyoto considered a resource for tourism in Kyoto City.

sen.j: 葵の花を飾った平安後期の装束での行列が有名。
sen.e: People marching with the late Heian period garment decorated with hollyhock flowers is famous.
People marching in late Heian period garments decorated with hollyhock flowers, is famous.
People marching in late Heian period garments decorated with hollyhock flowers, is famous.

sen.j: 斉王代が主役と思われがちだが祭りの主役は勅使代である。
sen.e: While it is generally thought that leading character of the festival is the acting High Priestess, actually, the main player is the acting Imperial delegate.
While it is generally thought that leading character of the festival is the acting High Priestess, actually, the main player is the acting Imperial delegate.
While it is generally thought that leading character of the festival is Saio-dai (the acting High Priestess), in fact, the main player is Chokushi-dai (the acting Imperial delegate).
sen.cmt: 補足しました。actually→in factに変更しました。

sen.j: 源氏物語中、光源氏が勅使を勤めるシーンが印象的である。
sen.e: In the Tale of Genji, scene that Hikaru Genji plays the Imperial delegate is impressive.
In the Tale of Genji, the scene of Hikaru Genji playing the Imperial delegate is impressive.
In the Tale of Genji, the scene of Hikaru Genji playing the Imperial delegate is impressive.

sen.j: 大気の不安定な時期に行なわれ、にわか雨に濡れることが多い。
sen.e: As the festival is held in the season of atmospheric instability, it is often people get soaked by the rain shower.
As the festival is held in the rainy season, people often are soaked by sudden rain showers.
As the festival is held in the rainy season, people often are soaked by sudden rain showers.

sen.j: さまざまな前儀が行われるが、中でも流鏑馬神事（やぶさめしんじ）が有名である。
sen.e: Though many pre-ritual events are taken place, Yabusame, a Shinto religious ceremonies of horseback archery is famous among them.
Though many pre-ritual events take place, Yabusame, a Shinto religious horseback archery ceremony is famous among them.
Although many pre-ritual events take place, Yabusame, a Shinto religious horseback archery ceremony is famous among them.

sen.j: 糺（ただす）の森の真中にある全長500メートルの馬場（ばば）を、公家風の装束姿や武家風の狩装束姿の射手（いて）たちが疾走する馬上から、３つの的を射抜くというものである。
sen.e: It is a ritual that at 500 meter long riding ground at the center of Tadasuno Mori forest, shooters in the court noble style official costume and warriors style hunting costume try to shoot down three targets on a running horseback..

It is a ritual that takes place along a 500 meter riding ground in the middle of the Tadasuno Mori forest, archers in court noble style official costumes and warrior style hunting costumes try to shoot down three targets from horseback.

It is a ritual that takes place along a 500 meter riding ground in the middle of the Tadasuno Mori forest, archers in court noble style official costumes and warrior style hunting costumes try to shoot down three targets from horseback.

sen.j: 「矢伏射馬（やぶさめ）」とも書かれる流鏑馬は、その文字が示すように矢を射ること。
sen.e: As Yabusame is also written as "矢伏射馬" in kanji characters, "流鏑馬" (Yabusame) is a horseback archery.
sen.cmt: この箇所を訳すには漢字表現が必用と考え、左記の様にしました。以下、必用に応じて採用しています。
sen.e: As Yabusame is also written as "矢伏射馬" in kanji characters, "流鏑馬" (Yabusame) is a horseback archery.
As yabusame is also written as '矢伏射馬' in kanji characters, yabusame is a horseback archery.
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションなどに修正しました。

sen.j: 馬を走らせながら正確に的を射抜く高度な技術が必要とされるため、人気の行事の一つである。
sen.e: It is one of the most popular events because highly skilled technique to precisely shoot down the targets while the horse runs is required.
It is one of the most popular events because a highly skilled technique is required to precisely shoot down targets while the horse runs.
It is one of the most popular events because a highly skilled technique is required to precisely shoot down targets while the horse runs.

sen.j: 雄略天皇の即位の年（４５７）、「騁射（うまゆみ）」を行ったと『日本書紀』が伝え、「賀茂祭に民衆を集めて騎射を禁ず」の記事が『続日本紀』にしるされるなど、古い歴史を持つ日本古来の馬術。
sen.e: As the entry of "Nihonshoki", a Chronicle of Japan tells that in the year of accedence of the Emperor Yuryaku (A.D. 457), they held "騁射"(Umayumi, horseback archery) and "Shoku Nihongi", "the Sequel of Chronicle of Japan" tells that "horseback archery shall be prohibited when people get together at the Kamo Matsuri Festival", it is a Japanese equestrian art since ancient time that has a long history.

An entry in the "Nihonshoki," (Chronicles of Japan), explains that in the year of the accedence of the Emperor Yuryaku (A.D. 457), they practiced "騁射"(Umayumi, horseback archery) and in the "Shoku Nihongi" (the Sequel of the Chronicles of Japan) it explains that "horseback archery shall be prohibited when people get together at the Kamo Matsuri Festival," it has been a Japanese equestrian art with a long history since ancient times.

An entry in the "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) explains that in the year of the enthronement Emperor Yuryaku (in 457), they practiced 'Umayumi' (horseback archery), and in the "Shoku Nihongi" (the Sequel of the Chronicles of Japan) it explains that 'horseback archery shall be prohibited when people get together at the Kamo Matsuri Festival,' it has been a Japanese equestrian art with a long history since ancient times.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションの位置など変えました。

sen.j: 射手のかけ声「イン、ヨー」とは「陰陽」のこと。
sen.e: The shouting of the shooter, "In, Yo" means "yin-yang".
The archer shouts "In, Yo" which means "yin-yang."
The archer shouts 'In, Yo' which means 'yin-yang.'
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションにしました。

sen.j: みごと矢が的中すれば五穀は稔り、諸願は成就すると言い伝えられている。
sen.e: When the arrows shot down the targets, it is believed that Gokoku (the five cereals: simile of harvest) are promised for abundant grain harvests, and wishes come true.
When the arrows hit the targets, it is believed that Gokoku (the five cereals: similes of harvest) are promised for abundant grain harvests, and wishes come true.
When the arrows hit the targets, it is believed that gokoku (the five cereals: similes of harvest) are promised for abundant grain harvests, and wishes come true.

sen.j: 文亀二年（１５０２）に中絶したが、昭和４８年、下鴨神社式年遷宮の記念行事として復活。
sen.e: Once it had been broken off in 1502, it resumed in 1973 as a memorial event of Transfer of a deity to a new shrine building once in a prescribed number of years of Shimogamo jinja Shrine.
It had stopped in 1502, but resumed again in 1973, held as a memorial event for the of Transfer of a deity to a new shrine building as prescribed in the number of years for Shimogamo jinja Shrine.
It had stopped in 1502, but resumed again in 1973, held as a memorial event for the of Transfer of a deity to a new shrine building as prescribed in the number of years for Shimogamo-jinja Shrine.

sen.j: 「糺の森流鏑馬神事保存会」によって公家装束による流鏑馬が保存・伝承されている。
sen.e: Yabusame in court noble style official costume is handed down by an organization called "Tadasuno Mori Yabusame Jinji hozonkai".
Yabusame in court noble style official costume is handed down by an organization called "Tadasuno Mori Yabusame Jinji hozonkai".
Yabusame in court noble style official costume is handed down by an organization called 'Tadasu no Mori Yabusame Jinji hozonkai' (Yabusame in Tadasu no Mori Preservation Association).

sen.j: また、上賀茂神社では競馬会神事(くらべうまえじんじ)などが執り行われる。
sen.e: At Kamigamo jinja-Shrine, horse competition ritual, etc is performed.
At Kamigamo jinja-Shrine, a horse competition ritual is performed.
At Kamigamo-jinja Shrine, a horse competition ritual is performed.

tit.j: 勅使および勅使代・・・路頭の儀と社頭の儀
tit.e: Imperial delegate and acting Imperial delegate…On road ceremony and on shrine ceremony
Imperial delegates and acting Imperial delegates…On road ceremony and ceremony at the shrine location
Imperial delegates and acting Imperial delegates: On road ceremony and ceremony at the shrine location
tit.cmt: コロンを使用しました。

sen.j: 5月15日には平安時代の衣装を身にまとった人々が牛車とともに京都御所から下鴨神社を経て上賀茂神社まで、近衛使と、警備のための「検非違使尉」と「検非違使志」といった検非違使庁の官吏と、山城使と、馬寮使、内蔵使による本列として行進する。
sen.e: On May 15th, people in the costume of Heian period march with gissha (cow carriage) from Kyoto Imperial Palace via Shimogamo-jinja Shrine to Kamigamo-jinja Shrine and Konoeshi (Imperial Guard delegate), and as guards, officers from "Kebiishi-cho" such as "Kebiishi jo", (second officer of the imperial police bureau), "Kebiishi shi", (third officer of the imperial police bureau), delegate of the Province of Yamashiro, the Horse office delegate, and delegate of the Inner Treasury Office escort, and made a Honretsu (main march).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の対処外:原文が不完全です。最初から一文になっていないものを一文にまとめ、括弧書きの部分を別の文章にしました。
sen.e: On May 15th, people dressed in Heian period costumes march with a gissha (cow carriage) from Kyoto Imperial Palace via Shimogamo-jinja Shrine to Kamigamo-jinja Shrine and Konoeshi (Imperial Guard delegate), and as guards, officers from "Kebiishi-cho" such as "Kebiishi jo," (second officer of the imperial police bureau), "Kebiishi shi," (third officer of the imperial police bureau), delegate of the Province of Yamashiro, the Horse office delegate, and delegate of the Inner Treasury Office escort, and make a Honretsu (main march).

On May 15, people dressed in Heian period costumes march with a gissha (cow carriage) from Kyoto Imperial Palace via Shimogamo-jinja Shrine to Kamigamo-jinja Shrine and Konoe no tsukai (Imperial Guard delegate), and as guards, officers from Kebiishicho (Office of Police and Judicial Chief) such as 'Kebiishi jo' (second officer of the imperial police bureau), 'Kebiishi shi' (third officer of the imperial police bureau), Yamashiro no tsukai (delegate of the Yamashiro Province), Maryo no tsukai (delegate of Maryo (the section taking care of imperial horses)), and Kura no tsukai (delegate of Kuraryo (the Inner Treasury Office)), and make a main march.
sen.cmt: 日時表記をかえ、用語表記を変えました。

sen.j: 斎王代をはじめとする女人列による路頭の儀（ろとうのぎ）が行われる。
sen.e: And a march led by women such as the acting High Priestess made a Nyonin-retsu (women's march), and this completes the on road ceremony.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の対処外
sen.e: A march is led by women, the acting High Priestess makes a Nyonin-retsu (women's march), and this completes the on road ceremony.
A march is led by women, Saio-dai makes a Nyonin-retsu (women's march), and this holds Roto no gi (the on road ceremony).

sen.j: 近衛使：（かつては、近衛府が賀茂祭の勅使として遣わされる慣例があったため。
sen.e: Konoeshi-The acting Imperial Guard delegate (Imperial delegate): This is because that Konoefu, (Imperial Guard Office) used to be dispatched to Kamo matsuri as Imperial Delegate.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の対処外
sen.e: Konoeshi-The acting Imperial Guard delegate (Imperial delegate): This is because the Konoefu, (Imperial Guard Office) used to be dispatched to the Kamo matsuri as an Imperial Delegate.
Konoeshi (The acting Imperial Guard delegate (Imperial delegate): This is because the Konoefu (Imperial Guard Office) used to be dispatched to the Kamo matsuri as an Imperial Delegate.

sen.j: もっとも、現在実際の天皇の使いである勅使は行列には加わらず、近衛使（勅使）代と呼ばれる代行者が行列に参加している。)
sen.e: However, today, Imperial delegate (the delegate of real Emperor) does not participate in the march, a representative called the acting Imperial Guard delegate (Imperial delegate) participate in the march.

However, today, the Imperial delegate (the delegate of the real Emperor) does not participate in the march, a representative called the acting Imperial Guard delegate (Imperial delegate) participates instead.

However, today, the Imperial delegate (the delegate of the real Emperor) does not participate in the march, a representative called Konoeshi-dai (the acting Imperial Guard delegate) participates instead.

sen.j: 山城使：（やましろのつかい、賀茂神社は、京職の管轄外で山城国の国官の管轄であったため、国府次官の「山城介」を警備と監督にあてた)。
sen.e: Yamashiro no tsukai (delegate of the Province of Yamashiro): Because Kamo-jinja Shrine was not under control of Kyoshiki (the Capital Bureau) but under the provincial office of Yamashiro Province, thus "Yamashirono suke"(Deputy governor of the Province of Yamashiro) was dispatched as a guard and director of the ceremony.

Yamashiro no tsukai (delegate of the Province of Yamashiro): Because Kamo-jinja Shrine was not under the control of Kyoshiki (the Capital Bureau), but under the provincial office of Yamashiro Province, thus "Yamashirono suke"(Deputy governor of the Province of Yamashiro) was dispatched as a guard and director of the ceremony.

Yamashiro no tsukai: Because Kamo-jinja Shrine was not under the control of Kyoshiki (the Capital Bureau), but under the provincial office of the Yamashiro Province, thus 'Yamashiro no suke' (Deputy governor of the Yamashiro Province) was dispatched as a guard and director of the ceremony.
sen.cmt: 前出用語補足をのぞき、表記を変えました。

sen.j: 馬寮使：（まりょうのつかい左馬允という左馬寮の官吏を充てた)。
sen.e: Maryo no tsukai (the Horse office delegate): samjo (third officer of the Horse Office of the Left was dispatched).
Maryo no tsukai (the Horse office delegate): samjo (third officer of the Horse Office of the Left was dispatched).
Maryo no tsukai: Sama no jo (third officer of the Horse Office of the Left) was dispatched).
sen.cmt: 前出用語補足をのぞき、表記を変えました。

sen.j: 内蔵使：（くらのつかい、「内蔵助」と「内蔵史生」という天皇の幣帛を管理する内蔵寮の官吏をあてた)。
sen.e: Kura no tsukai (delegate of the Inner Treasury Office): "Uchikuranosuke", Assistant Head of the Inner Treasury Office and "Uchikura shisho", the officer clerk of the Inner Treasury Office who were in charge of Paper or cloth strips attached to a stick and offered to a deity are dispatched.

Kura no tsukai (delegate of the Inner Treasury Office): "Uchikuranosuke," (Assistant Head of the Inner Treasury Office) and "Uchikura shisho," (the office clerk of the Inner Treasury Office) who were in charge of Paper or cloth strips attached to a stick and offered to a deity are dispatched.

Kura no tsukai: 'Uchikura no suke' (Assistant Head of the Inner Treasury Office) and 'Uchikura shisho' (the office clerk of the Inner Treasury Office) who were in charge of paper or cloth strips attached to a stick and offered to a deity are dispatched.
sen.cmt: 前出用語補足をのぞき、表記を変えました。

sen.j: 下鴨神社と上賀茂神社において、実際の勅使である掌典職の掌典が祭文を奏上する社頭の儀（しゃとうのぎ）がとり行われる。
sen.e: At Shimogamo jinja Shrine and Kamikamo-jinja Shrine, actual Imperial Delegate, Shotenshoku (ceremonial master) notifies ceremonial message and on shrine ceremony is carried out..
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の対処外
sen.e: At Shimogamo jinja Shrine and Kamikamo-jinja Shrine, the actual Imperial Delegate, Shotenshoku (ceremonial master) announces the ceremonial message and the ceremony is carried out at the shrine.
At Shimogamo-jinja Shrine and Kamigamo-jinja Shrine, the actual Imperial delegate, Shotenshoku (ceremonial master) announces the ceremonial message and the ceremony is carried out at the shrine.

sen.j: これが社頭の儀である。
sen.e: This is shato-no-gi or on shrine ceremony.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の対処外
sen.e: This is shato-no-gi or ceremony conducted on the shrine premises.
This is Shato no gi (ceremony conducted on the shrine premises).

sen.j: 路頭の儀（行列を見る）有料拝観席（御所と下鴨神社参道）の受付→京都市観光協会
sen.e: To see the on road ceremony (to see the march), charged seats are available at the Imperial Palace and Promenade to Shimogamo jinja Shrine. Contact Kyoto City Tourist Association.
To see the on road ceremony (the march), seat reservation for a fee, are available at the Imperial Palace and Promenade to Shimogamo jinja Shrine. Contact the Kyoto City Tourist Association.
The Roto no gi (to see the march): For seat reservation (at the Imperial Palace and the promenade to Shimogamo-jinja Shrine) for a fee, contact the Kyoto City Tourist Association.
sen.cmt: コロンを使用し、表記を変えました。

sen.j: 社頭の儀（儀式を見る）有料拝観席（下鴨神社楼門内）の受付→下鴨神社
sen.e: To see the on shrine ceremony (to see the ceremony at the shrine), charged seats are available at the shrine. Contact Shimogamo-jinja Shrine.
To see the on shrine ceremony (at the shrine), seat reservations for a fee are available at the shrine. Contact Shimogamo-jinja Shrine.
The Shato no gi (to see the ceremony): For seat reservations (in the romon (two-storey gate) of Shimogamo-jinja Shrine) for a fee, contact Shimogamo-jinja Shrine.
sen.cmt: コロンを使用し、表記を変えました。

sen.j: 斎王（さいおう）とは、賀茂神社に巫女として仕えるために皇室から差し出された内親王または女王 (皇族)のこと。
sen.e: The High priestess is an imperial princess or queen (of the imperial family) who is served from the Imperial family as the priestess at Kamo-jinja Shrine.
The High priestess is an imperial princess or queen from the Imperial family who served as the priestess at Kamo-jinja Shrine.
Saio (the High priestess) is an imperial princess or queen from the Imperial family who served as miko (a shrine maiden) at Kamo-jinja Shrine.

sen.j: 現在では京都在住の一般市民から選ばれるので斎王代（さいおうだい）となる。
sen.e: Today, the priestess is selected among general public of the Kyoto residents, it is actually an acting High priestess.
Today, the priestess is selected among the general public of the Kyoto residents, and is actually an acting High priestess.
Today, it is selected among the general public of the Kyoto residents, and is in fact Saio-dai (an acting High priestess).
sen.cmt: 表現を変えました。actually →in factに変更しました。

sen.j: ただし、「一般公募」を受け付ける窓口は存在しない。
sen.e: However, there is no formal office for public applications for the acting High priestess.
However, there is no formal office for receiving public applications for the acting High priestess.
However, there is no formal office for receiving 'public applications' for Saio-dai.

sen.j: 唐衣裳装束（からぎぬもしょうぞく）を着用、舞台化粧と同様の厚化粧をし、お歯黒も付ける。
sen.e: She wears Chinese dress costume, and is heavily made up like a theatrical actress, and appeared in painted black teeth.
She wears Chinese dress, and is heavily made up like a theatrical actress, and her teeth are painted black.
She wears Karaginu-mo Shozoku (Chinese dress costume), and is heavily made up like a theatrical actress, and her teeth are painted black.

sen.j: また毎年５月４日には斎王代禊（みそぎ）の儀が行われる。
sen.e: On May 4th every year, purifying ceremony of the acting High priestess is taken place.
On May 4th every year, a purifying ceremony of the acting High priestess takes place.
On May 4 in every year, Saio-dai Misogi no gi (a purifying ceremony of the acting High priestess) takes place.
sen.cmt: 日時表記などを変えました。

sen.j: 斎王代と女人たちが御手洗池（みたらしいけ）に手を浸し清める儀式で、下鴨神社と上賀茂神社両社で隔年交替で行われる。
sen.e: It is a ceremony that Acting High priestess and females involved in the ritual soaked their hands in the Mitarashi-ike pond and purify themselves, and the ceremony is taken place at Shimogamo-jinja Shrine and Kamigamo-jinja Shrine every other year.

Acting High priestess and females involved in the ritual soak their hands in the Mitarashi-ike pond and purify themselves, and the ceremony takes place at Shimogamo-jinja Shrine and Kamigamo-jinja Shrine every other year.

It is the ceremony that Saio-dai and females involved in the ritual soak their hands in the Mitarashi-ike pond and purify themselves, and it takes place at Shimogamo-jinja Shrine and Kamigamo-jinja Shrine every other year.

sen.j: 斎王代を中心としてその周囲に女童（めのわらわ）、騎女（うまのりのおんな）、采女（うねめ）、女官、等の華やかで可憐な行列が続く。
sen.e: At the center of the march is the Acting high priestess, and the girls, horseback ladies and court ladies from provinces, and court ladies follows and gorgeous and pretty parade marches on.
At the center of the march is the Acting high priestess, and the lady attandants, ladies on horseback, and court ladies from the provinces follow and a gorgeous parade marches on.

At the center of the march is Saio-dai, and Me no Warawa (the lady attendants), Umanori no Onna (ladies on horseback), and Uneme (court ladies from provinces), nyokan (court ladies) follow and a gorgeous parade marches on.

sen.j: 全員が舞台化粧と同様の厚化粧をするが、斎王代以外はお歯黒を付けない。
sen.e: All of them put on heavy makeup like theatrical makeup but no one paint their teeth black except for the Acting high priestess.
All of them put on heavy makeup like theatrical makeup but no one paints their teeth black except for the Acting high priestess.
All of them put on heavy makeup like theatrical makeup but no one paints their teeth black except for Saio-dai.
